docs.text: in our time .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in our modern world , where the cool rule , it's hard to imagine that shakespeare is becoming 'the man' .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and yet - film after film , after film , is based on his everlasting magic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in warner brothers' latest production , shakespeare is kicking ass to a rap beat , while his magic and intelligence slowly fades away .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: though the producers of the matrix have vaguely based their picture on william shakespeare's 'romeo and juliet' , its title sequence with a frightening rap song and a black limo making its way through the dark streets of new york , is very hard to associate with shakespeare's poetry .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film takes place during a silent war between the two major mafia families in the city - the afro americans against the chinese .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the youngest son of a chinese mafia chieftain is found murdered .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the afro-americans are immediately suspected , but a peace treaty is signed between the two godfathers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is at this point that han ( the romeo of the story ) finds out about his brother's death .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: escaping from a prison in china , he returns to united states to avenge his brother's fate .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but before he can restore justice with his kung fu kicks , he falls in love with a mysterious beauty .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the only problem is that she is the daughter of his enemy . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's only a weak echo of shakespeare's talent in this disappointing production .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and there are more problems besides its title .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course we don't call it a deformation of a great masterpiece .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we call it 'modernization' .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it seems that the producers fear that the audience will not respond to lyrics , without any car chases and gun fights .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this lack of respect for the audience i find very disturbing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kenneth brannagh has already proven that shakespeare doesn't need to be updated , because his tales are grounded in the basics of life and human nature .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and as long as love , hate , honesty and corruption do exist , everyone will understand and embrace shakespeare .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i must admit that i found 'rome must die' very confusing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i can forgive andrzej bartkowiak , since it is his first attempt at directing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he manages to create an incredible atmosphere and directs with a firm precision .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately he completely forgot about character- and story developments .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his latest picture is therefore visually impressive , but intellectually hollow .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the love story between han ( jet li ) and trish ( aalyah ) , and the mafia intrigues are undeveloped and simplified .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jet li is one of the most amazing fighters to ever hit the silver screen and aalyah has a magical voice .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: their achievement save this film from being completely braindead , but they are not actors , and therefore can not act .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they are nothing more than two celebrities put together .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the other actors , including isaiah washington , russell wong , henry o and dmx all give the standard mediocre performances .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: delroy lindo is the only one that projects a coherent image of reality .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but there's more than acting to worry about .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even with li's incredible skills in martial arts , the action scenes ( though technically excellent ) are too long and story updates simply embarrassing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to make a long story short : 'romeo must die' is not intelligent enough to be a thriller , not sensual enough to be a love story and too serious to be a fun action film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is certain that bartkowiak would be much better off with o this embarrassing and completely unnecessary parallel to 'romeo and juliet' , so the film is completely stuck - not sure of what to be .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and in the end it's nothing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are no performances worthy of notice , no interesting character- or story surprises .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so again , the only good thing about it is its technical achievement .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this film can boast of great sound , fast paced editing , solid cinematography and some very well coordinated action sequences .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the music is another factor that prevents you from leaving the theatre .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is mostly provided by aalyah's enchanting voice and several carefully inserted rap songs by various artists , that create a kind of 'ghetto feel' to it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but when i think back , it's not much i remember from this 'production' .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as in almost every summer movie , there are some interesting scenes , but most of the moments that i remember are associated with massive special effects .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is not a film that will get any attention for its artistic qualities , simply because it doesn't have any .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for someone who has never read shakespeare , it's another popcorn film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for those of us who has , it's a waste of money , time and brain cells .
docs.label: negative
